review: Mini Vrindavan In Mumbai.ISKCON - Govardhan Ecovillage in Wada is the vision of Radhanath Swami Maharaj, and I am thankful to him as he gave us the opportunity to experience some taste of Vrindavan.This place is filled with spirituality, and you will get to experience a lot of things.Right from the entrance, you will witness the warmth and love of Shrimati Radharani and Shri Krishna.I have been visiting this place for over 5 years now and I can tell you, every time I visit this place with my family or alone, I always get to learn something new.I did my residential program of Bhagavad-Gita and Bhakti yoga in Govardhan Ecovillage. It was the most beautiful experience that will always stay with me.Whenever I get time, I will book 2 days or 4 days' stay and spend my time here chanting and attending Yamuna aarti nd Yagna and mangal aarti.Remember, this is a spiritual place, and they have a schedule to follow for you. I won't break the surprise, but I want you to go and experience it.In Iskcon - Women are called "Mataji," and men are called "Prabhuji," irrespective of their job.Food is simple and tasty, You can enjoy a meal at 2 places - Shrinathji cafe ( for visitors) and Govind Cafe ( located inside the stay area).All the food is without garlic and onion as tese both ingredients are considered as Tamasic food.I can keep on sharing more information, but I would like you to visit the place.Remember, everyone greets each other by saying Hare Krishna or Radhe Radhe or Hari Bol.
